db:abstract.db:para: The QBluetoothDeviceInfo class stores information about the Bluetooth device.
This class was introduced in Qt 5.2.

db:section.db:title: Detailed Description
db:section.db:para: QBluetoothDeviceInfo provides information about a Bluetooth device's name, address and class of device.

db:section.db:title: [since 5.4] enum QBluetoothDeviceInfo::CoreConfiguration
db:section.db:para: This enum describes the configuration of the device.

db:td.db:para: The type of the Bluetooth device cannot be determined.
The device is a standard Bluetooth device.
The device is a Bluetooth Smart device with support for standard and Low Energy device.
The device is a Bluetooth Low Energy device.

db:section.db:para: This enum was introduced or modified in Qt 5.4.
The CoreConfigurations type is a typedef for QFlags<CoreConfiguration>. It stores an OR combination of CoreConfiguration values.

db:section.db:title: enum QBluetoothDeviceInfo::DataCompleteness
db:section.db:para: This enum describes the completeness of the received data.

db:td.db:para: The data is incomplete. Addition datum is available via other interfaces.

db:section.db:title: [since 5.12] enum QBluetoothDeviceInfo::Field
db:section.db:para: This enum is used in conjuntion with the QBluetoothDeviceDiscoveryAgent::deviceUpdated() signal and indicates the field that changed.

db:td.db:para: The rssi() value of the device changed.

db:section.db:para: This enum was introduced or modified in Qt 5.12.
The Fields type is a typedef for QFlags<Field>. It stores an OR combination of Field values.

db:section.db:title: enum QBluetoothDeviceInfo::MajorDeviceClass
db:section.db:para: This enum describes a Bluetooth device's major device class.

db:td.db:para: A device that provides access to a local area network.
A device capable of playback or capture of audio and/or video.
A peripheral device such as a keyboard, mouse, and so on.
An imaging device such as a display, printer, scanner or camera.
A wearable device such as a watch or pager.
A health reated device such as heart rate or temperature monitor.
A device that does not fit into any of the other device classes.

db:section.db:title: enum QBluetoothDeviceInfo::MinorAudioVideoClass
db:section.db:para: This enum describes the minor device classes for audio/video devices.

db:td.db:para: A video display with built-in loudspeaker.

db:section.db:title: enum QBluetoothDeviceInfo::MinorComputerClass
db:section.db:para: This enum describes the minor device classes for computer devices.

db:td.db:para: A clamshell handheld computer or PDA.

db:section.db:title: enum QBluetoothDeviceInfo::MinorHealthClass
db:section.db:para: This enum describes the minor device classes for health devices.

db:section.db:title: enum QBluetoothDeviceInfo::MinorImagingClass
db:section.db:para: This enum describes the minor device classes for imaging devices.

db:td.db:para: A device capable of displaying images.

db:section.db:title: enum QBluetoothDeviceInfo::MinorMiscellaneousClass
db:section.db:para: This enum describes the minor device classes for miscellaneous Bluetooth devices.

db:section.db:title: enum QBluetoothDeviceInfo::MinorNetworkClass
db:section.db:para: This enum describes the minor device classes for local area network access devices. Local area network access devices use the minor device class to specify the current network utilization.

db:td.db:para: 100% of the total bandwidth is available.
0 - 17% of the total bandwidth is currently being used.
17 - 33% of the total bandwidth is currently being used.
33 - 50% of the total bandwidth is currently being used.
50 - 67% of the total bandwidth is currently being used.
67 - 83% of the total bandwidth is currently being used.
83 - 99% of the total bandwidth is currently being used.

db:section.db:title: enum QBluetoothDeviceInfo::MinorPeripheralClass
db:section.db:para: This enum describes the minor device classes for peripheral devices.

db:td.db:para: A pointing device, for example a mouse.
A keyboard with built-in pointing device.

db:section.db:title: enum QBluetoothDeviceInfo::MinorPhoneClass
db:section.db:para: This enum describes the minor device classes for phone devices.

db:td.db:para: A wired modem or voice gateway.
A device that provides ISDN access.

db:section.db:title: enum QBluetoothDeviceInfo::MinorToyClass
db:section.db:para: This enum describes the minor device classes for toy devices.

db:td.db:para: A toy doll or action figure.

db:section.db:title: enum QBluetoothDeviceInfo::MinorWearableClass
db:section.db:para: This enum describes the minor device classes for wearable devices.

db:section.db:title: enum QBluetoothDeviceInfo::ServiceClass
db:section.db:para: This enum describes the service class of the Bluetooth device. The service class is used as a rudimentary form of service discovery. It is meant to provide a list of the types of services that the device might provide.

db:td.db:para: The device does not provide any services.
The device provides object transfer services.
The device provides services of all types.

db:section.db:para: The ServiceClasses type is a typedef for QFlags<ServiceClass>. It stores an OR combination of ServiceClass values.

db:section.db:title: QBluetoothDeviceInfo::QBluetoothDeviceInfo()
db:section.db:para: Constructs an invalid QBluetoothDeviceInfo object.

db:section.db:title: QBluetoothDeviceInfo::QBluetoothDeviceInfo(const QBluetoothAddress &address, const QString &name, quint32 classOfDevice)

db:constructorsynopsis.db:synopsisinfo: QBluetoothDeviceInfo(const QBluetoothAddress &address, const QString &name, quint32 classOfDevice)

db:section.db:para: Constructs a QBluetoothDeviceInfo object with Bluetooth address address, device name name and the encoded class of device classOfDevice.
The classOfDevice parameter is encoded in the following format

db:section.db:title: [since 5.5] QBluetoothDeviceInfo::QBluetoothDeviceInfo(const QBluetoothUuid &uuid, const QString &name, quint32 classOfDevice)

db:constructorsynopsis.db:synopsisinfo: QBluetoothDeviceInfo(const QBluetoothUuid &uuid, const QString &name, quint32 classOfDevice)

db:section.db:para: Constructs a QBluetoothDeviceInfo object with unique uuid, device name name and the encoded class of device classOfDevice.

This constructor is required for Low Energy devices on macOS and iOS. CoreBluetooth API hides addresses and provides unique UUIDs to identify a device. This UUID is not the same thing as a service UUID and is required to work later with CoreBluetooth API and discovered devices.
This function was introduced in Qt 5.5.

db:section.db:title: QBluetoothDeviceInfo::QBluetoothDeviceInfo(const QBluetoothDeviceInfo &other)
db:section.db:para: Constructs a QBluetoothDeviceInfo that is a copy of other.

db:section.db:title: QBluetoothDeviceInfo::~QBluetoothDeviceInfo()
db:section.db:para: Destroys the QBluetoothDeviceInfo.

db:section.db:title: QBluetoothAddress QBluetoothDeviceInfo::address() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the address of the device.

db:note.db:para: On iOS and macOS this address is invalid. Instead deviceUuid() should be used. Those two platforms do not expose Bluetooth addresses for found Bluetooth devices and utilize unique device identifiers.

db:section.db:title: [since 5.4] QBluetoothDeviceInfo::CoreConfigurations QBluetoothDeviceInfo::coreConfigurations() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the configuration of the device. If device configuration is not set, basic rate device configuration will be returned.
This function was introduced in Qt 5.4.

db:section.db:title: [since 5.5] QBluetoothUuid QBluetoothDeviceInfo::deviceUuid() const
db:section.db:para: Returns a unique identifier for a Bluetooth device without an address.

In general, this uuid is invalid on every platform but macOS and iOS. It is used as a workaround for those two platforms as they do not provide Bluetooth addresses for found Bluetooth Low Energy devices. Every other platform uses address() instead.
This function was introduced in Qt 5.5.

db:section.db:title: bool QBluetoothDeviceInfo::isCached() const
db:section.db:para: Returns true if the QBluetoothDeviceInfo object is created from cached data.

db:section.db:title: bool QBluetoothDeviceInfo::isValid() const
db:section.db:para: Returns true if the QBluetoothDeviceInfo object is valid, otherwise returns false.

db:section.db:title: QBluetoothDeviceInfo::MajorDeviceClass QBluetoothDeviceInfo::majorDeviceClass() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the major device class of the device.

db:section.db:title: [since 5.12] QByteArray QBluetoothDeviceInfo::manufacturerData(quint16 manufacturerId) const
db:section.db:para: Returns the data associated with the given manufacturerId.
Manufacturer data is defined by the Supplement to the Bluetooth Core Specification and consists of two segments:

db:listitem.db:para: Manufacturer specific identifier code from the Assigned Numbers Company Identifiers document

db:section.db:para: The interpretation of the data octets is defined by the manufacturer specified by the company identifier.
This function was introduced in Qt 5.12.

db:section.db:title: [since 5.12] QHash<quint16, QByteArray> QBluetoothDeviceInfo::manufacturerData() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the complete set of all manufacturer data.
This function was introduced in Qt 5.12.

db:section.db:title: [since 5.12] QVector<quint16> QBluetoothDeviceInfo::manufacturerIds() const
db:section.db:para: Returns all manufacturer ids attached to this device information.
This function was introduced in Qt 5.12.

db:section.db:title: quint8 QBluetoothDeviceInfo::minorDeviceClass() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the minor device class of the device. The actual information is context dependent on the value of majorDeviceClass().

db:section.db:title: QString QBluetoothDeviceInfo::name() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the name assigned to the device.

db:section.db:title: qint16 QBluetoothDeviceInfo::rssi() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the signal strength when the device was last scanned

db:section.db:title: QBluetoothDeviceInfo::ServiceClasses QBluetoothDeviceInfo::serviceClasses() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the service class of the device.

db:section.db:title: QList<QBluetoothUuid> QBluetoothDeviceInfo::serviceUuids(QBluetoothDeviceInfo::DataCompleteness *completeness = nullptr) const
db:section.db:para: Returns the list of service UUIDS supported by the device. If completeness is not 0 it will be set to DataComplete and the complete list of UUIDs supported by the device is returned. DataIncomplete if additional service UUIDs are supported by the device and DataUnavailable if no service UUID information is available.
This function requires both the Bluetooth devices to support the 2.1 specification.

db:section.db:title: QBluetoothDeviceInfo::DataCompleteness QBluetoothDeviceInfo::serviceUuidsCompleteness() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the completeness of the service UUID list. If DataComplete is returned, serviceUuids() returns the complete list of service UUIDs supported by the device, otherwise only the partial or empty list of service UUIDs. To get a list of all services supported by the device, a full service discovery needs to be performed.

db:section.db:title: void QBluetoothDeviceInfo::setCached(bool cached)
db:section.db:para: Used by the system to set the cached flag if the QBluetoothDeviceInfo is created from cached data. Cached information may not be as accurate as data read from an active device.

db:section.db:title: [since 5.4] void QBluetoothDeviceInfo::setCoreConfigurations(QBluetoothDeviceInfo::CoreConfigurations coreConfigs)
db:section.db:para: Sets the CoreConfigurations of the device to coreConfigs. This will help to make a difference between regular and Low Energy devices.
This function was introduced in Qt 5.4.

db:section.db:title: [since 5.5] void QBluetoothDeviceInfo::setDeviceUuid(const QBluetoothUuid &uuid)
db:section.db:para: Sets the unique identifier uuid for Bluetooth devices, that do not have addresses. This happens on macOS and iOS, where the CoreBluetooth API hides addresses, but provides UUIDs to identify devices/peripherals.
This uuid is invalid on any other platform.
This function was introduced in Qt 5.5.

db:section.db:title: [since 5.12] bool QBluetoothDeviceInfo::setManufacturerData(quint16 manufacturerId, const QByteArray &data)
db:section.db:para: Sets the advertised manufacturer data for the given manufacturerId. Returns true if it was inserted or changed, false if it was already known.
This function was introduced in Qt 5.12.

db:section.db:title: void QBluetoothDeviceInfo::setRssi(qint16 signal)
db:section.db:para: Set the signal strength value, used internally.

db:section.db:title: void QBluetoothDeviceInfo::setServiceUuids(const QList<QBluetoothUuid> &uuids, QBluetoothDeviceInfo::DataCompleteness completeness)
db:section.db:para: Sets the list of service UUIDs to uuids and the completeness of the data to completeness.

db:section.db:title: bool QBluetoothDeviceInfo::operator!=(const QBluetoothDeviceInfo &other) const
db:section.db:para: Returns true if this object is different from other, or false otherwise.

db:section.db:title: QBluetoothDeviceInfo &QBluetoothDeviceInfo::operator=(const QBluetoothDeviceInfo &other)
db:section.db:para: Makes a copy of the other and assigns it to this QBluetoothDeviceInfo object.

db:section.db:title: bool QBluetoothDeviceInfo::operator==(const QBluetoothDeviceInfo &other) const
db:section.db:para: Returns true if the other QBluetoothDeviceInfo object and this are identical.
